Posts.Content: MarieTherese wrote: Hi All I am a first time poster. I had a mammogram and a sonogram ( dense breast tissue) done on Wednesday. I was told that I do not have a mass, but that the tissues are pulling and distorted? There is no lump, but there seems to be any area of concern and I have to have an ultra sound guided core needle biopsy next week. The area of concern is less than 1cm long and .5cm wide. They asked me several times if I had had a car accident or trauma to that breast and I have not that I can recall. I do have a history of benign cysts and saw several of them floating by on the U/S. ( the tech confirmed that they were cysts) I am 48 with no family history of breast cancer, but my mother also has dense breast tissue, cystic breasts and has gone for at 3 or 4 biopsies that were all negative. The radiologist was so vague and I just couldn't think of what to ask. The more I read online, the more confused I get. Are there any questions that I should be asking the day of the biopsy? I have a ton of them of course, but what can they actually tell you? Can I ask to see the images and have them explained to me? Any advice would be greatly appreciated as I am in absolute shock and do not know how to process any of this. Dx 8/7/2015, DCIS/IDC, Right, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Surgery 9/11/2015 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Area of Distortion and Core needle Biopsy MarieTherese MarieTherese

Posts.Content: MarieTherese wrote: How often does the diagnosis change radically from the first biopsy to post lumpectomy? Any input would be appreciated MT Dx 8/7/2015, DCIS/IDC, Right, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Surgery 9/11/2015 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I am panicking! Changes in diagnosis?? MarieTherese BarredOwl

Posts.Content: MarieTherese wrote: Hi all- Had surgery last week. Encouraging news ( other than an upgrade to stage 2), no complications.Healing well physically, but I suddenly feel sooo down. It feels like I have just been diagnosed all over again (- bad dreams, crying, that awful feeling in your stomach) MT Dx 8/7/2015, DCIS/IDC, Right, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Surgery 9/11/2015 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
